total_revenue.notes: Microsoft Cloud and AI strength drove the growth

operating_income.notes: Operating margin expanded to 45% as operating expenses grew only 5%

net_income.notes: Includes a $2.3B other expense primarily from the Cruise impairment

highlights: Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services revenue +15%
Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services +8%
Server products and cloud services revenue +21%
Azure AI services growth +157%, contributing 13 points of Azure growth
Search and news advertising ex-TAC revenue +21%

Azure_AI_services.notes: Capacity constraints continue, but AI services remain ahead of expectations

expenses.note: Operating expenses grew 5% while Microsoft Cloud gross margin percentage remained in line, reflecting disciplined spend.

capital_expenditures.notes: Includes finance leases; more than half invested in long-lived cloud and AI assets

AI_and_cloud: Microsoft Cloud surpassed $40B in revenue, and the AI business run rate exceeded $13B, up 175% YoY.
Data center capacity more than doubled over the last three years while refreshing the fleet with AMD, Intel, NVIDIA, and first-party silicon (Maia, Cobalt, Boost, HSM).
Azure AI Foundry reached over 200,000 monthly active users within two months, and the SLM family has been downloaded more than 20M times.
productivity: Microsoft 365 Copilot seats have expanded more than 10x over 18 months for early customers and Copilot usage intensity rose over 60% sequentially.
Copilot Studio has been used by over 160,000 organizations to build 400,000 custom agents in the last three months.
Microsoft Fabric now has more than 19,000 paid customers, and Power BI usage is 30M monthly active users, up 40% YoY.
consumer_and_search: Copilot consumer app added Think Deeper (o1) globally, while Copilot+ PCs represented 15% of premium-priced holiday laptops.
LinkedIn premiums surpassed $2B in annual revenue with engagement up 37% YoY, and new AI features support recruiters and small businesses.
Edge exceeded 30% market share on Windows in the U.S., Bing and Edge share gains continued, and search/news advertising ex-TAC grew 21%.
security_and_gaming: Security Copilot customers resolve incidents 30% faster, and Microsoft Purview audits over 2B Copilot interactions daily.
Black Ops 6 was the top-selling game and Xbox Cloud Gaming streamed a record 140M hours; Game Pass set a new quarterly revenue record with PC subscribers growing over 30%.

fx_headwinds.q3: Strengthening U.S. dollar reduces total revenue growth by ~2 points (Productivity and Intelligent Cloud -2, More Personal -1) and lowers COGS growth by ~2 points and operating expense growth by ~1 point.
fx_headwinds.q4: FX is expected to further decrease Q4 revenue and COGS growth by more than 1 point and operating expenses by roughly 1 point.

q3_guidance.Productivity_and_Business_Processes: Revenue growth 11-12% CC or $29.4-29.7B; Microsoft 365 commercial cloud growth 14-15% CC; M365 commercial products roughly flat; consumer cloud mid- to high-single digits; LinkedIn low- to mid-single digits; Dynamics 365 mid-teens.
q3_guidance.Intelligent_Cloud: Revenue growth 19-20% CC or $25.9-26.2B; Azure growth 31-32% CC with AI services constrained by capacity; non-AI services healthy though facing go-to-market execution adjustments; on-prem server revenue mid-single-digit decline; Enterprise and Partner Services low- to mid-single digits.
q3_guidance.More_Personal_Computing: Revenue $12.4-12.8B with higher-margin focus; Windows OEM decline low- to mid-single digits, devices down; Search and news advertising ex-TAC mid-teens (overall search mid- to high-single digits); Xbox content and services low- to mid-single digit growth, hardware down.
q3_guidance.Company: COGS growth 19-20% CC or $21.65-21.85B, operating expense growth 5-6% CC or $16.4-16.5B, other income and expense roughly negative $1B, and tax rate about 18%.

capital_and_longer_term.capex: Expect Q3 and Q4 spend near Q2 levels; FY26 CapEx growth to moderate with mix shifting toward short-lived, revenue-correlated assets while keeping fleet fungible.
capital_and_longer_term.long_term_guidance: FY25 should deliver double-digit revenue and operating income growth with slightly higher operating margins and an effective tax rate between 18% and 19%.

metadata.source: Microsoft FY 2025 Q2 earnings release and earnings call transcript
